ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Guided_wave_terminal is a type of that is explicitly included for the purpose of providing access to the functionality of a using guided waves.

The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
A Package is a type of a . A Package may be a . A Package describes the physical container of a . A Package includes no more than one package body and one or more package terminals. A Package orientation is defined using a , which references the Package as a scope. It is possible to have several referencing a Package due to the need to support multiple . The simplest case is one shape for a Package, with one which is at the centroid of the Package shape. Since Package and are not themselves interpreted as shape_representations, it is the usual case that there will be one Package, combination even though there may be multiple shape_representations for the Package, and each of those shape_representations are in a geometric context that also includes an that is the placement transformation of the shape of the in that shape_representation. There shall be no more than one for a Package.
The shape of the itself is required to only include one , an at the origin of the shape definition. The shape of the is required to be a .
Figures through illustrate types of Packages and parameters related to Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing supported by this part of ISO 10303. ISO 10303-202 would be used in conjunction with this part of ISO 10303 to define the exchange of the presentation information (i.e., the drawings). This part of ISO 10303 supports the direct application to application exchange of the parametric data illustrated in the drawings.
Figures through illustrate parameters and features related to Package orientation for assembly purposes supported by this part of ISO 10303. ISO 10303-202 would be used in conjunction with this part of ISO 10303 to define the exchange of the presentation information (i.e., the drawings).
When used for a "white box model", the is installed in the Package and an electrical connection is defined between each terminal on the installed and one or more terminals on the Package.

the of_datum_reference_frame is an inverse relationship that specifies the tha t specifies the Package as its scope. The in this role shall be . The provide capability to unambiguously orient the component in the assembly. The representation of a may be placed in different shape representations since there is only one shape definition for a .
the package_tertiary_orientation_feature is an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Package as its . There shall be no more than one for a Package in this role.
the package_secondary_orientation_feature is an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Package as its . There shall be no more than one for a Package in this role.
the package_primary_orientation_feature is an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Package as its . There shall be no more than one for a Package in this role.
the package_polarity_indication is an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Package as its . There shall be no more than one for a Package in this role.

the package_accesses is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Package is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Package as its . There shall be zero or more for a Package.

the interface_plane is an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Package as its . The simulates the interface surface of an external device. There may be more than one in the role of interface_plane.
The interface_plane is typically used for connectors, but may be used for modules.
A use of interface_plane is in the case of a fiber-optic transceiver that is mounted on a PCB but has a right angle connector to interface with a fiber.

the package_seating_plane is an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Package as its . The simulates the mounting surface for the terminals in the case of surface mounted parts and in the case of through-hole technology, an arbitrarily established mounting surface. Terminals are required to approach the from the top, which is the side where the values on the Z axis are positive. Package installation is defined to be only from the top of the in order to reduce orientation errors between two-dimensional and three-dimensional models in this part of ISO 10303.
the body is an inverse relationship that specifies the that specifies the Package as its . There shall be no more than one Package_body for a Package.

the cutout_required specifies a derived value of TRUE or FALSE, depending on the existence of the optional attribute maximum_body_height_below_seating_plane. If the attribute exists, the value is TRUE. If the attribute is no present, the value is FALSE.

the least_lead_length_below_seating_plane is a that specifies the smallest lead length below the seating plane. The least_lead_length_below_seating_plane need not be specified for a particular Package.

the maximum_lead_length_below_seating_plane is a that specifies the maximum lead length below the seating plane. The maximum_lead_length_below_seating_plane need not be specified for a particular Package.
the minimum_body_clearance_below_seating_plane specifies a that is the minimum length between the body and the . A minimum_body_clearance_below_seating_plane need not be specified for a Package.
the minimum_body_clearance_above_seating_plane specifies a that is the minimum length between the body and the . A minimum_body_clearance_below_seating_plane need not be specified for a Package.

the maximum_body_clearance_below_seating_plane specifies a that is the maximum length between the body and the bottom of the . A maximum_body_clearance_below_seating_plane need not be specified for a Package.

the maximum_body_clearance_above_seating_plane specifies a that is the maximum length between the body and the top of the . A maximum_body_clearance_above_seating_plane need not be specified for a Package.

the maximum_body_height_below_seating_plane is a that specifies the maximum height of the Package below the seating plane. The maximum_body_height_below_seating_plane need not be specified for a particular Package.

the maximum_body_height_above_seating_plane is a that specifies the maximum height of the Package above the seating plane. Since there is no attribute describing the maximum terminal height above the seating plane, this attribute shall be interpreted as the furthest point away from the seating plane of either the body or of any above the seating plane.
In the case of package to be mounted in a cutout there may only be the surface mounted leads protruding above the seating plane.

the mounting_technology specifies a value of surface_mount or through_hole for the Package. Surface_mount indicates that the Package_terminals have a that is congruent with the package_seating_plane and through_hole indicates the terminals penetrate the package_seating_plane.

The text is out of date (rule descriptions)
A Package_body is a type of that is the encasement used in the realization of a . The observer view shall be above the seating plane and shall be higher than the highest point of the Package_body.
the associated_definition specifies the role of the for the Package_body.
the body_material specifies the used in the manufacture of the Package_body.
A Package_body_bottom_surface is a type of that is not visible from an observer located so as to place the component on a substrate.
A Package_body_edge_segment_surface is a type of .
the end_vertex specifies the for the Package_body_edge_segment_surface.
the start_vertex specifies the for the Package_body_edge_segment_surface.
the composed_surface specifies the for the Package_body_edge_segment_surface.
A Package_body_edge_surface is a type of .

A Package_body_surface is a type of . A Package_body_surface may be one of a , a , a , or a . A Package_body_surface relationship to the seating plane may be explicitly established, helping to unambiguously orient the .
A package_body_top_surface is a type of that is visible from any observer located so as to place the component on a substrate.

The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
A Package_terminal is a type of . A Package_terminal may be one or more of a , a , a , or a . When the case or package body is used as a terminal then Package_terminal shall be populated to specify the feature of the that serves that purpose. The Package_terminal shall be in a sequence, with the initial member being , and each member that is not a shall reference a previous member in the sequence using the precedent_feature attribute inherited from . The seating_plane_zone shall not exist if the seating_plane_intersection attribute is 'does not intersect'. The seating_plane_intersection attribute shall not be 'does not intersect' if the seating_plane_zone attribute exists.
The referenced indirectly by this terminal may be in the role of for the referenced by associaed_definition.
Figure illustrates a cutaway view of a terminal and shows the characteristics related to a terminal.
the feature_shape specifies the role of the for the Package_terminal. There shall be one or more Feature_shape_occurrence for the Package_terminal.

the maximum_terminal_diametrical_extent specifies the that represents the maximum allowed diameter of a Package_terminal. The need not be specified for a Package_terminal. The is the diameter of a circle that circumscribes the cross-sectional shape of the terminal.

the minimum_terminal_diametrical_extent specifies the that represents the minimum allowed diameter of a Package_terminal. The need not be specified for a Package_terminal. The is the diameter of a circle that circumscribes the cross-sectional shape of the terminal.
the terminal_core_material specifies the role of the for the Package_terminal core material. The terminal_core_material is optional and need not be supplied.

the terminal_characteristic specifies the of the Package_terminal. The terminal_characteristic need not be specified for a particular Package_terminal. There may be more than one Characteristic for a Package_terminal.
the terminal_surface_material specifies the role of the for the outer surface of the Package_terminal surface material.

the seating_plane_intersection specifies whether or not the shape of the Package_terminal intersects the shape of the seating plane to within the tolerance of the geometric context. The values allowed for the attribute are 'surface_intersection', 'through_intersection', 'does_not_intersect'.
Not all terminals need to intersect the seating plane.

the internal_connection_zone_specifies the on the inside portion of the Package_terminal. There may be more than one in the role of internal_connection_zone. The internal_connection_zone need not be specified for a particular Package_terminal.

the external_connection_zone specifies the on the outside surface of the Package_terminal. There may be more than one for a Package_terminal. The external_connection_zone is optional and need not be supplied if the source system does not contain the data. If the source system contains the data, then the external_connection_zone shall be supplied.
The specified by the terminal or mounting feature may be the same Feature_shape_occurrence that is specified by the associated . In this case the whole terminal is the .
the associated_definition specifies the role of the for the Package_terminal.
A Package_terminal_surface_constituent_relationship is a type of . It associates the surface of the package to a terminal via .

A Primary_reference_terminal is a type of . This terminal is assigned the identifier string that is first in the sequence of package terminal names to be assigned to the part. The Primary_reference_terminal shall not specify a precedent_feature and is the first member of the sequence of . The sort order of the names assigned to the Packaged_terminals is defined by the explicit sequence established by the use of precedent_feature inherited from .
If a value of '1' is available, assigning a value of '2' to this terminal would be prohibited by this part of ISO 10303, due to the possibility of confusion.
The Primary_reference_terminal is often associated with an orientation feature, but it may not be the orientation feature itself. Usually the Primary_reference_terminal and the are different part_features.

A Functional_orientation_feature is a type of . A Functional_orientation_feature provides visible or tactile means to reduce or eliminate ambiguity of the location of a in an assembly operation. A Functional_orientation_feature augments the basis for orientation in the CAD system and acts as a mapping operator between the CAD model and the real world.
Other orientation information may be required in addition to the Functional_orientation_feature to totally disambiguate the correct orientation.
A mark on a component implemented with ink or a visible indentation or a formed corner may be used to indicate the fact that pin one of the package is in close proximity to the mark. A vision system or a human operator will use the mark to correctly orient the component.
the associated_terminal specifies the for the Functional_orientation_feature.

the associated_body_vertical_extent specifies the for the Functional_orientation_feature. There shall be one or two package_body_surfaces for a Functional_orientation_feature. The value of this attribute is optional and need not be specified.

A Polarity_indication_feature is a type of . A Polarity_indication_feature provides visible or tactile means to reduce or eliminate ambiguity of the location of a polarized part in an assembly operation. A Polarity_indication_feature shall not be used to identify orientation features of non-polarized components.
Other orientation information may be required in addition to the Polarity_indication_feature to totally disambiguate the correct orientation.

A Primary_orientation_feature is a type of and is a type of . A Primary_orientation_feature participates in providing for the unambiguos orientation of a part on its next assembly.
A Primary_orientation_feature is not necessarily also a .
Figure illustrates two of the three-dimensional geometric relationships between a component and the printed circuit board it is mounted on. A is included for reference purposes. The Z direction is parallel to the normal of the top surface of the board. Both the top and bottom surface normal vectors are parallel to the normal vectors of the seating plane for the components.
Figure illustrates two of the two-dimensional geometric relationships between a component and the printed circuit board it is mounted on. A is included for reference purposes.
Three-dimensional assembly relationships Two-dimensional assembly relationships
Figures through illustrates orientation details for microcircuit packages.
Twenty pin orientation features Eight lead gull wing orientation features Eight lead DIP orientation features TO-99 orientation features Ball grid array orientation features
Figure illustrates details associated with several variations of an Axial package modification and the associated . In all these cases, the seating plane orientation with respect to the is constant, while the shape orientation changes due to the modification.
Axial modifications and resulting orientations
Figure illustrates assignment and also assignment of . Knowledge of Polarity_indication_features separate from the orientation feature increases the ability to determine when to use polarity indication symbols on the interconnect substrate for polarized components e.g., polarized capacitors, diodes).
and for discrete devices
A Secondary_orientation_feature is both a and a . A secondary_orientation_feature provides anti-rotation capability for unambiguous orientation of the part in the .

an associated_body_vertical_extent specifies the role of the for a Secondary_orientation_feature. The associated_body_vertical_extent helps to identify the surface or surfaces which contain the feature. An associated_body_vertical_extent need not be specified for a Secondary_orientation_feature.
A Tertiary_orientation_feature is both a and a . A tertiary_orientation_feature provides anti-rotation capability for unambiguous orientation of the part in the .

an associated_body_vertical_extent specifies the role of the for a Tertiary_orientation_feature. The associated_body_vertical_extent helps to identify the surface or surfaces which contain the feature. An associated_body_vertical_extent need not be specified for a Tertiary_orientation_feature.

A Wire_terminal is a type of a whose core_material is inherently flexible and ready for installation to a without prior formal preparation by shape modification. The shape of the Wire_terminal is incompletely defined in the library.
The inherited by the terminal may be the same Feature_shape_occurrence that is specified by the associated . In this case the whole terminal is the .
the minimum_wire_terminal_length specifies the for the minimum length of the Wire_terminal.
the maximum_wire_terminal_length specifies the for the maximum length of the Wire_terminal.

the internal_connection_zone specifies the role of a for the Wire_terminal. There shall be one or more for the Wire_terminal. The internal_connection_zone is mandatory because it locates the end of the wire that is the attachment area on the package body.
